text: Kim Un-hyang (born 10 December 1992) is a North Korean ice hockey player. ==Career== She competed in the 2018 Winter Olympics as part of a unified team of 35 players drawn from both North and South Korea. The team's coach was Sarah Murray and the team was in Group B competing against Switzerland, Japan and Sweden. ==References== Category:1992 births Category:Living people Category:Ice hockey players at the 2018 Winter Olympics Category:North Korean women's ice hockey forwards Category:Olympic ice hockey players of North Korea Category:Winter Olympics competitors for Korea
title: Kim Un-hyang (ice hockey)
